title: Data Strategist - Ogilvy Philippines

pay_input_ranges.title: Pay Range

content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
About the Role  
A Data Strategist must have experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. 
What Youâ€™ll Do   
TECHNICAL
Proficient in Microsoft Excel for advanced data analysis
Experience in data collection/tagging/tracking, cleaning, and mining
Experience in visualizing data through different tools (Excel, Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, R, etc.)
Proficient in doing different types of analysis (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive) and when to apply each
Experience working with and creating data architectures
Has 2-5 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications is preferred
Experience using statistical tools and computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets is a plus, but not mandatory
Knowledge of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) a big plus, but not mandatory
A Masters or PHD in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field is a big plus, but not mandatory
DOMAIN
Has working and updated knowledge of how data works in the digital landscape, primarily social media, ecommerce platforms, as well as website analytics
Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc.
Experience working with data sets for creative/advertising agencies is a big plus, but not mandatory
What Youâ€™ll Need  
Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on marketing communication and business growth strategies
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
2-5 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models,
Related courses to Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field
How Weâ€™ll Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. Weâ€™ll empower you with the tools youâ€™ll need to succeed. Weâ€™ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. Weâ€™ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And weâ€™ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which youâ€™ll be proud, with people youâ€™ll be proud to call your teammates.  
The base salary range for this position at the time of this posting is indicated below. Individual compensation varies based on job-related factors, including location, business needs, level of responsibility, experience, and qualifications. We offer a competitive benefits package, click here for more details.Pay Rangeâ‚±44,000â€”â‚±67,000 PHPAt Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities â€“ and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
